DOC.brief_summary: Magnesium sulphate is given to the patients during the colorectal cancer surgery under the hypothesis that it would attenuate the postoperative hypercoagulability. The investigators intend to characterize the changes of coagulation in colorectal cancer patients by using the point-of-care device after the infusion of magnesium sulphate.
DOC.brief_title: Magnesium and Rotational Thromboelastometry (ROTEM) in Colorectal Cancer Surgery
DOC.criteria: The patients undergoing a laparoscopic colorectal cancer surgery Renal disease Hepatic disease Neuromuscular disease Coagulation disorder Cardiopulmonary disease
